Reason: The configuration option 'counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms' is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because the timeout duration directly impacts the performance of counter write operations at the system level. If the timeout value is set too low, it may lead to timeouts and potential failures in counter write operations, affecting system performance. Additionally, the configuration involves time-sensitive operations related to waiting for write operations to complete, which can contribute to notable performance variations in the system.
